quiz.text: What is the relation between Quantity I and Quantity II? Quantity I: 65 men can do a piece of work in 16 days. In how many days 112 men can complete the work? Quantity II: A can do a work in 12 days, B can do work in 24 days and C can do a work in 48 days. Find how many days they all work together to complete the double work?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity II ≤ Quantity I
Quantity II >Quantity I
Quantity II =Quantity I

quiz.text: What is the relation between Quantity I and Quantity II? Quantity I: Two trains 360 m and 450 m long are running in opposite directions at 36 km/hr and 54 km/hr respectively. In what time will they be clear of each other from the moment they meet? Quantity II: There are two leakages in the bottom of the cistern. Both together empty the cistern in 12 minutes. If the first leakage alone empties it in 30 minutes, then in how many minutes will the second leakage alone empty it?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity II ≤  Quantity I
Quantity II >Quantity I
Quantity II =Quantity I

This mixture is now remixed with mixture A & mixture B in ratio 3: 2. Find ratio of final quantity of milk in both mixtures.

2: 3
9: 11
8: 11
None of these
